timeline.message: Fixed double serialization issue, code review comments

timeline.body:
```suggestion
            return cosmosItem;
```
on this if branch the item is InternalObjectNode you don't need to serialze and deserialize again.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
return new InternalObjectNode(((InternalObjectNode) cosmosItem).toJson());
return cosmosItem;

on this if branch the item is InternalObjectNode you don't need to serialze and deserialize again.

replies.bodyText: We don't, as there is no item response here. We validate the delete tests using the status code of the returned response object.

timeline.bodyHTML:
return "/" + Optional.of(partitionKeyField)
                                 .map(f -> f.getAnnotation(PartitionKey.class))
                                 .map(PartitionKey::value)
                                 .filter(s -> !s.isEmpty())
                                 .orElseGet(partitionKeyField::getName);
timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText: Same here, right now we have a very straightforward if condition, changing it to this complex stream logic doesn't make sense. We don't really need java Stream's map, filter and orElseGet logic here.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyHTML:
return Optional.of(domainType)
                       .map(d -> d.getAnnotation(Container.class))
                       .map(Container::containerName)
                       .filter(s -> !s.isEmpty())
                       .map(ExpressionResolver::resolveExpression)
                       .orElseGet(domainType::getSimpleName);
timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText: Same here as above, this is very straightforward if condition. Changing this to Stream will be complicating the code in my opinion.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: chenrujun

timeline.bodyHTML:
Can we update logic in CosmosAsyncContainer#createItem

from

    public <T> Mono<CosmosItemResponse<T>> createItem(
        T item,
        PartitionKey partitionKey,
        CosmosItemRequestOptions options) {
        if (options == null) {
            options = new CosmosItemRequestOptions();
        }
        ModelBridgeInternal.setPartitionKey(options, partitionKey);
        return createItem(item, options);
    }

to

    public <T> Mono<CosmosItemResponse<T>> createItem(
        T item,
        PartitionKey partitionKey,
        CosmosItemRequestOptions options) {
        if (options == null) {
            options = new CosmosItemRequestOptions();
        }
        if (partitionKey != null) {
            ModelBridgeInternal.setPartitionKey(options, partitionKey);
        }
        return createItem(item, options);
    }

So we can delete if (partitionKey == null) here.
timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText:
It doesn't matter, as if the partitionKey is null, SDK will compute it based on the logic mentioned below.
I have kept the scope of this PR to touch minimal code in the Cosmos Java SDK layer.
replies.author: kushagraThapar
chenrujun

replies.bodyText: Yes, good suggestion @chenrujun  - I have updated the code.
replies.author: kushagraThapar
